items.title: 'Did that really happen?' - Macclesfield fancy another Premier League test
items.summary: Two days on from Macclesfield's stunning FA Cup third-round win over Crystal Palace, the heroics are still sinking in for manager John Rooney.

items.title: HSV stuurt sportief directeur weg wegens 'ernstig wangedrag'
items.summary: Het vertrek van Stefan Kuntz (63) als sportief directeur bij Hamburger SV heeft veel losgemaakt. De club kondigde onlangs in een kort en bondig statement zijn vertrek aan, maar nadat BILD onderzoek deed naar de werkelijke reden daarvan en ook Kuntz zich liet horen, voelde het zich genoodzaakt zelf ook met een statement te komen.

items.title: Positieve geluiden over van Ajax overgekomen Taylor na debuut in Itali√´
items.summary: Kenneth Taylor heeft zijn vuurdoop bij Lazio goed doorstaan na zijn transfer vanaf Ajax. Dat is de conclusie in Itali√´, onder meer getrokken door trainer Maurizio Sarri.

items.title: Sources: Carrick has backing for Man United job
items.summary: Michael Carrick has growing support within Manchester United for the role of interim manager, with sources telling ESPN that the former midfielder has significant backing.

items.title: Raphinha's 'intensity' leads Bar√ßa Supercopa win
items.summary: Barcelona manager Hansi Flick lauded Raphinha's mentality after the Brazilian haunted Real Madrid once again with two goals in his team's 3-2 Spanish Supercopa final win in Saudi Arabia on Sunday.

items.title: Fernandes' X account was hacked - Man United
items.summary: Manchester United released a statement announcing that captain Bruno Fernandes' social media platform X account was hacked.

items.title: Martinelli hat-trick as Arsenal beat Portsmouth
items.summary: Gabriel Martinelli scored a hat-trick as Arsenal overcame an early scare to thrash Championship strugglers Portsmouth 4-1 in the FA Cup third round.

items.title: 'Roma schakelt door naar Malen vanwege impasse rond Zirkzee'
items.summary: Donyell Malen kan zijn loopbaan mogelijk vervolgen bij AS Roma. De Romeinen zien in de 26-jarige aanvaller van Aston Villa een alternatief voor Joshua Zirkzee, zo is de laatste berichtgeving vanuit Itali√´.

items.title: 'United maakt vorderingen met zoektocht naar interim-manager'
items.summary: De tijd van winterse versterkingen is aangebroken, in dit blog volgen we alle transferactiviteit in het buitenland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in Nederland.

items.title: Kompany reageert op ophef rond Real Madrid-droom Karl: 'Kleine communicatiefout'
items.summary: Vincent Kompany heeft zich zondag uitgesproken over de ophef die ontstaan rond Lennart Karl. Het toptalent van Bayern M√ºnchen vertelde onlangs op een fandag dat het zijn droom is om ooit voor Real Madrid te spelen . Een onhandige uitspraak, vond ook Kompany, die daarna vooral zijn bewondering uitsprak. 'Als hij slecht traint of speelt, heeft hij een probleem met mij.'

items.title: Football transfer rumours: Liverpool and Chelsea eye Ram√≥n? Gallagher to Spurs?
items.summary: Today‚Äôs rumours need a bit of a stir Most footballers become famous for playing the game but others attract renown for not liking it ‚Äì foremost among them is Arsenal‚Äôs Ben White. Accordingly, it would make sense were he to join David Moyes‚Äôs Everton, who are seeking to resolve a problematic right-back situation. The chance to follow in the footsteps of Tony Hibbert, typically a huge pull factor, is nullified because White presumably has no idea who he is. Elsewhere on Merseyside, it appears Liverpool have finally discovered the best way to improve a dodgy defence is not to buss hundreds of millions on attackers, but to have decent defenders. Consequently, they are looking at Como‚Äôs Jacobo Ram√≥n ‚Äì and so too are Chelsea, should the romance of being stockpiled with a 68-year contract prove too alluring to turn down. Continue reading...

items.title: Qatar in talks with Fifa to host first Women‚Äôs Club World Cup in January 2028
items.summary: Qatar has no Fifa women‚Äôs ranking after lack of games January tournament will disrupt domestic seasons Qatar is in talks with Fifa about staging the inaugural Women‚Äôs Club World Cup, which is in line to cause major disruption to domestic seasons in 2027-28, including in Europe. Fifa announced last month that its latest new club competition would take place from 5 to 30 January 2028, but the governing body has not said where it will be held or whether it will run a formal bidding process. Continue reading...

items.title: Carrick favourite for Man Utd caretaker role
items.summary: Michael Carrick emerges as favourite for the Manchester United caretaker role with club chiefs hoping to have an appointment in place for when players return to training on Wednesday.

items.title: FA Cup third round: 10 talking points from the weekend‚Äôs football
items.summary: Crystal Palace‚Äôs stars wilt, Manchester City‚Äôs youngsters shine, and Liam Rosenior starts in stylish fashion Playing against lower-league opposition as a top-flight side in the FA Cup is like batting on the first morning of a Test match ‚Äì you cannot really win and failure can prompt humiliation and reputational damage. To that end, some members of the Crystal Palace side deservedly beaten by Macclesfield perhaps learned a valuable lesson at Moss Rose. Marc Gu√©hi and Adam Wharton are linked regularly with big moves away from Palace, but part of succeeding at elite clubs ‚Äì the pair are admired by Manchester City and Manchester United respectively ‚Äì is coping with being overwhelming favourites. Oliver Glasner, too, may have designs on bigger things, with United again a possible destination, but to see his side schooled by part-timers was a blow to his burgeoning reputation. Glasner slammed his players after the defeat but the Austrian must take a portion of the blame. They must all do better. Dominic Booth Report: Macclesfield 2-1 Crystal Palace Report: Manchester City 10-1 Exeter Report: Manchester United 1-2 Brighton Report: Derby 1-3 Leeds Continue reading...

items.title: Evans knocked out of Australian Open qualifying as Norrie wins in Auckland
items.summary: Former British No 1 Dan Evans is out of Australian Open qualifying following a first-round defeat to Japan's Rei Sakamoto.

items.title: Nunc Est Bibendum chases hat-trick on Lingfield Monday card
items.summary: It's a busy Monday on Sky Sports Racing, with Lingfield and Hereford hosting action before evening racing on Wolverhampton's all-weather.

items.title: Are fans being turned off multi-club ownership model?
items.summary: Strasbourg fans thought they had it good from being aligned with Chelsea. Then manager Liam Rosenior walked out mid-season to take charge of the Blues.

items.title: 'I'll get goosebumps' - Barnsley duo out to upset old club Liverpool
items.summary: For Adam Phillips and Vimal Yoganathan, it could be the fulfilment of a lifelong dream when Barnsley take on Liverpool at Anfield on Monday.

items.title: Maye leads Patriots past Chargers to claim first playoff win
items.summary: Drake Maye threw a touchdown pass to Hunter Henry in the fourth quarter as the New England Patriots defense roughed up Justin Herbert in a 16-3 AFC Wild Card playoff victory over the Los Angeles Chargers.

items.title: Chargers vs Patriots | Wild Card Weekend Highlights
